history.prompt: show me disks and space avail

response.instructions:
This command will show disk space usage in a human-readable format, displaying disk size, used space, available space, and percentage used for each mounted filesystem.

Prerequisites: You should have root or appropriate permissions to run this command. The 'df' command is typically available on most Unix-like systems.

Expected output:
You should see a list of partitions with their respective details. For example:

Filesystem     Size  Used Available Use% | Mounted on
-----------------------------------------
/dev/sda1        50G   40G    10G  80% /boot
/dev/sda2       500G 300G  200G  60% /home
...

If the output is too long or you want more details, you can add options like '-h' for human-readable numbers.
response.title: Display Disk Space Usage
